81-year-old.context: This is an 81-year-old gentleman who underwent septorhinoplasty many years ago.

squamous cell carcinoma.context: Squamous cell carcinoma, left nasal cavity.

nasal endoscopy.context: The 0-degree nasal endoscope was then used to examine the nasal cavity more completely.

partial rhinectomy.context: Operations Performed: 1. Nasal endoscopy.   2. Partial rhinectomy.

tenderness.context: He has been complaining of tenderness and induration of his nasal tip for approximately two years.

induration.context: He has been complaining of tenderness and induration of his nasal tip for approximately two years.

erythema.context: The preoperative examination shows induration of the nasal tip without significant erythema.

focal tenderness.context: There is focal tenderness just cephalad to the alar crease.

lesion.context: There is no lesion either externally or intranasally.

diffuse invasive squamous cell carcinoma.context: A diagnosis of diffuse invasive squamous cell carcinoma was rendered.

submucosal tissue.context: The submucosal tissue was thickened diffusely, but there was no identifiable distinct or circumscribed lesion present.

random biopsies.context: Random biopsies of the submucosal tissue were taken and submitted to pathology for frozen section.

alar incision.context: An alar incision was made with a #15 blade and the full-thickness incision was completed with the electrocautery.

full-thickness incision.context: An alar incision was made with a #15 blade and the full-thickness incision was completed with the electrocautery.

electrocautery.context: An alar incision was made with a #15 blade and the full-thickness incision was completed with the electrocautery.

soft tissue.context: Additional soft tissue was then taken from all margins tagging them for the pathologist.

Joseph elevator.context: A Joseph elevator was used to elevate the periosteum off the maxillary process and off the inferior aspect of the nasal bone.

periosteum.context: A Joseph elevator was used to elevate the periosteum off the maxillary process and off the inferior aspect of the nasal bone.

maxillary process.context: A Joseph elevator was used to elevate the periosteum off the maxillary process and off the inferior aspect of the nasal bone.

nasal bone.context: A Joseph elevator was used to elevate the periosteum off the maxillary process and off the inferior aspect of the nasal bone.

5-mm chisel.context: A 5-mm chisel was used to take down the inferior aspect of the nasal bone and the medial-most aspect of the maxilla.

inferior aspect.context: A 5-mm chisel was used to take down the inferior aspect of the nasal bone and the medial-most aspect of the maxilla.

medial-most aspect.context: A 5-mm chisel was used to take down the inferior aspect of the nasal bone and the medial-most aspect of the maxilla.

maxilla.context: A 5-mm chisel was used to take down the inferior aspect of the nasal bone and the medial-most aspect of the maxilla.

Xeroform gauze.context: Xeroform gauze was then fashioned to cover the defect and was sutured along the periphery of the wound with interrupted 6-0 nylon suture to provide a barrier and moisture.

interrupted 6-0 nylon suture.context: Xeroform gauze was then fashioned to cover the defect and was sutured along the periphery of the wound with interrupted 6-0 nylon suture to provide a barrier and moisture.

Afrin.context: Following induction of adequate general endotracheal anesthesia, the left nose was decongested with Afrin.

general endotracheal anesthesia.context: Following induction of adequate general endotracheal anesthesia, the left nose was decongested with Afrin.

septorhinoplasty.context: This is an 81-year-old gentleman who underwent septorhinoplasty many years ago.

skin lesion.context: He also has a history of a skin lesion, which was removed from the nasal ala many years ago, the details of which he does not recall.

folliculitis.context: He has been treated unsuccessfully for folliculitis and cellulitis of the nasal tip.

cellulitis.context: He has been treated unsuccessfully for folliculitis and cellulitis of the nasal tip.

nasal tip.context: He has been complaining of tenderness and induration of his nasal tip for approximately two years.

alar crease.context: There is focal tenderness just cephalad to the alar crease.

nasal ala.context: He also has a history of a skin lesion, which was removed from the nasal ala many years ago, the details of which he does not recall.

Dr. A.context: He was evaluated by Dr. A, who performed the septorhinoplasty, and underwent an intranasal biopsy, which showed histologic evidence of invasive squamous cell carcinoma.

nares.context: There was slight asymmetry of the nares.

intercartilaginous area.context: No lesion was seen within the nasal cavity either in the area of the intercartilaginous area, which was biopsied by Dr. A, the septum, the lateral nasal wall, and the floor.

lateral nasal wall.context: No lesion was seen within the nasal cavity either in the area of the intercartilaginous area, which was biopsied by Dr. A, the septum, the lateral nasal wall, and the floor.

floor.context: No lesion was seen within the nasal cavity either in the area of the intercartilaginous area, which was biopsied by Dr. A, the septum, the lateral nasal wall, and the floor.

biopsy.context: No lesion was seen within the nasal cavity either in the area of the intercartilaginous area, which was biopsied by Dr. A, the septum, the lateral nasal wall, and the floor.

histologic evidence.context: He was evaluated by Dr. A, who performed the septorhinoplasty, and underwent an intranasal biopsy, which showed histologic evidence of invasive squamous cell carcinoma.

invasive squamous cell carcinoma.context: He was evaluated by Dr. A, who performed the septorhinoplasty, and underwent an intranasal biopsy, which showed histologic evidence of invasive squamous cell carcinoma.

PACU.context: The anesthetic was then discontinued as the patient was extubated and transferred to the PACU in good condition having tolerated the procedure well.

sponge and needle counts.context: Sponge and needle counts were correct.
